humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the maximum dimension of the invasive component of the tumor as 2.8 cm. Based on the rules provided, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage is determined by the size of the primary tumor. In this report, the primary tumor is described as an 'infiltrating ductal carcinoma' that 'measures 2.8 CM in maximum dimension'. This corresponds to a T2 stage, as T1 is up to 2 cm, T2 is 2-5 cm, T3 is more than 5 cm, and T4 involves the chest wall or skin. Therefore, the T stage from this report is T2.
